description: Making web applications usable by everyone, including people with disabilities
guidelines: Provide text alternatives for non-text content
Ensure sufficient color contrast (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for large text)
Make all functionality keyboard accessible
Give users enough time to read and use content
Don't use color as the only means of conveying information
Help users navigate and find content
Make text readable and understandable
Make pages appear and operate predictably

requirements: Text can be resized up to 200%
No background audio or can be turned off
Paragraph spacing of at least 1.5x font size

guidelines: Label all form inputs clearly
Group related fields with fieldsets
Provide clear error messages
Don't rely solely on placeholder text
Make error messages specific and helpful
Announce form validation to screen readers
aria_patterns: aria-label for inputs without visible labels

guidelines: Provide skip links to main content
Use semantic HTML5 nav elements
Indicate current page in navigation
Ensure logical tab order
Provide multiple navigation methods
Trap focus within modal when open
Return focus to trigger element on close
Provide close button and Escape key handling
Announce modal opening to screen readers
Prevent interaction with background content

manual: Test with screen reader (NVDA, JAWS, VoiceOver)
Disable CSS and check content order
